Old bread: >>52440727

Welcome to the Raidcat / 6 Star Tera Raid Meta Thread

>lol I can solo 5 star raids I don't need your ugly cat
6 stars are infinitely harder than 5 and extremely annoying. You can do them the normal way and risk wasting your time, or accept the raidcat as your raid savior.

>What's the meta?
4 Perrserkers. Their Hidden Ability stacks multiplicatively and, if you follow the flowchart, you can one-shot most raids.

>What's the raidcat like?
Perrserker @ Lum Berry
Level 100
Ability: Steely Spirit (Hidden Ability)
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 Speed (Host) or HP (Joiner)
Adamant Nature
- Iron Head
- Screech
- Swords Dance
- Taunt (Host) / Helping Hand (Joiner)

>Host? Joiner? Flowchart?
There's a small difference in strategy whether you are hosting or joining a raid and a specific flowchart. See OP pic.

>Does this work every time?
No, but it's one of the only consistent strategies that you can follow. It's not great against Pokemon that have strong and/or STAB Fire/Fighting/Ground moves, and if their Tera resists Steel it can also take a few more turn (but still doable).

>So what's the hype?
Catraids are simple to organize, have plenty of flowcharts, and finish the job very quickly. It's about efficiency.

>I have a question about raids...
Check OP pic.

>How to get cat with HA?
Language Teacher sidequest, then use an Ability Patch to change its ability. Patch is an 11% drop from 6 Star Raids.

>I tried breeding but I'm getting Kantonian Meowth
Make the G-Meowth hold an Everstone

>wtf I did that but none of them have Steely Spirit
G-Meowth's HA is Unnerve, it becomes Steely Spirit upon evolution.

For other viable meta strategies and mons, Ctrl+F OTHERMONS

For specific strategies, Ctrl+F HARDRAIDS

Use this thread to trade for raidcats, to organize (raidcat) raids, or just to discuss and ask questions about raids in general.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>52447670
There's never really been anything like it that I've seen since. It can be broken down in to many different recent trends happening at the exact same time with the exact same property.
>MCU
Everyone watched the tv show and there was merch for it fucking everywhere. Action figures, posters, happy meals, shirts, cups, anything you could think of just like the MCU was at its peak
>Fidget spinners
Pokemon cards were very similar to this. Even down to the shady adults buying them in bulk and trying to sell them at flea markets.
>Fortnite
its the best modern equivalent to how the game was, but it was still different because of no internet. Everyone was playing it and there'd always be rumors about glitches and cheat codes. In my case no one ever really traded or battled because of having no link cables. When you chose your starter, it was a big deal because there was pretty much no way to get the others. Chances are you'd be stuck with haunter/kadabra/machoke forever. Getting something like Gyarados or Dragonite felt like a monumental task. I say its similar to fortnite though just because of the huge popularity fortnite had that one summer.

I'm was 90% sure that the "imagination" theory is the correct one, but something keeps bothering me.
The main reason people think the imagination theory is the right one is because of the DLC legendaries and because Arvin mentions that the Pokemon were spotted way before the time machine was ever made. That combined with the vague nature of the dex entries, the paradox Pokemon being in cryptid magazines, etc.
Here's where I'm starting to doubt things.
We already know that one person in the past outright mentions that something took over his mind and made him draw weird shit in the Scarlet book while he was down in area 0. While the Virizon hybrid and Suicune hybrid are described as just being a made up fantasy something drew for fun, there's no proving that the person who drew them also wasn't influenced by whatever the third legendary is. So while we assumed that the DLC legendaries are just made up, they could really be from ancient times and the third big legendary "showed" this to the person who drew them in some way.
On the topic of the other past Pokemon of area 0... we really don't know if Sada only sent Pokemon from the past to her timeline. For all we know she sent Pokemon from the past to 200 years ago, by accident. Then those Pokemon were discovered by the people who wrote the Scarlet book and cryptid magazines, and in turn inspired Sada to make the machine.
That's what makes them paradoxes. Like the Song of Storms from zelda.

>>52443948
>>people take that as people saying its bad altogether and not even bothering to question why
Same could be apply for most of the critiques against Gen2 but that's a different story.
Meganium is the least optimal starter to use but its in-game badness is overblown. Even the common argument if Johto being bad for Grass types because of the Gym Leaders falls if you actually look at every gym leader.

>Falkner
Bad, Everything resists Razor Leaf so it has to rely on tackle while Falkner can Gust it to death.
>Bugsy
Complete Shit. Razor leaf is a joke, and Scyther can Fury Cut it to death.
>Whitney
Great. Can Poison Powder her Miltank before it gets going and use Reflect to tank its attacks.
>Morty
Bad, Normal and Grass moves do nothing to his team. Mud Slap super-effective but its so weak that Razor Leaf is a better choice, Also Curse makes tanking difficult
>Chuck
Great. Primeape is a nothingburger and Poliwrath is weak to grass
>Jasmine
Good. Steel being strong against grass doesn't matter. Meganium resists all her Magmemites' Electric attacks and Magnemite is 4x weak to ground making Mud Slap a great move. Also Steelix is neutral to grass and has low Special Defense
>Pryce
Good. His entire team is weak to grass, and while Meganium is weak to Ice its can screen to tank which may not even be necessary
>Clair,
Good, Dragon resists Grass but Meganium resists most of Clair's Pokemon's moves' (Electric and Water) while taking neutral damage to Dragon. Only weakness is Ice Beam from one Dragoniair. Keep in mind it can Poison Power and Screen to tank.

Note, Team Rocket's poison types coudl give it trouble but they are mostly incompetent unleveled grunts. And it actually is bad against the Elite 4. But for the gyms its only Bad against 3 with and Falkner is weak enough that being weak to him isn't that bad.

>>52448409
The Gen 9 group's greatest strength is framing. Arven is considered the least competent battler and yet he's still more credible than a lot of what preceded him. Hop in particular has pretty confused storytelling about his self confidence and level of competency. Something like Gen 9 can't really be done the same way again though. They work because Penny and Nemona aren't truly battled until the end, and Arven grows stronger over the course of the game, not losing any credibility because he mostly battles beside you.

The only rival with framing as good as them is Blue. He works despite his constant losses because he cavalier about everything and never takes those losses seriously. When someone like Bede goes into denial over losing to you, he's written as though he doesn't truly believe what he's saying. Blue believes his own bullshit, which is what makes him good.
